nut noun
(PERSON)
[ C ] offensive, informal an offensive word for a person who has a mental illness
[ C ] informal a person who behaves in a very silly, stupid, or strange way: What kind of nut would leave a car on a railway track?
[ C ] informal someone who is extremely enthusiastic about a particular activity or thing: James is a tennis nut - he plays every day. See also
nuts adjective informal
More examplesFewer examplesHe's a nut, he's a crazy guy.Some people may look at me and think I'm a nut to live in such a tiny apartment.I work out seven days a week. I'm a nut.You don't have to be a car nut to care what you drive.

nut noun
(MUSIC)
[ C ]
  music
  specialized a small, raised piece of hard material at the top of the neck of a musical instrument such as a guitar or a violin that the strings pass over : The top two strings have been left a little high at the nut. At the nut of the bass, the neck is quite wide, with wide string spacing.
[ C ]
  music
  specialized the bottom part of a bow (= a long, thin piece of wood with hair from the tail of a horse stretched along it, used to play musical instruments that have strings) : A violin is usually played using a bow consisting of a stick with a ribbon of horsehair strung between the tip and nut at opposite ends. Synonym
frog
More examplesFewer examplesIf you strum an open G chord, you'll hear a strange ringing noise, which is the G string vibrating behind the nut.I had to replace the nuts on both guitars because the slots were wide enough to fit two strings in each.The G should be played throughout with short bows near the nut.The strings were about an inch off the fingerboard, but I slowly started filing down the nut until I ended up with a lower action.
